title: Riot should add monthly status cards
body:
http://imgur.com/LJN4dFZ

Once a month doesn't seem like it would bother anyone, and it would be quite useful. Knowing how many of our reports are labeled as false would make a lot more people trust the system, and having the chat logs of the games where the report was deemed as accurate would help us identify attitudes the community dislikes even if we haven't been punished. It would also let us send messages to Riot Support with inaccurate accurate reports, to help them improve the system.

It would probably also make people less surprised about incoming punishments - if the monthly status card says that your account is in poor standings, then people can try to reform and better themselves without even needing to be punished. Likewise, if you've been punished recently and then the monthly status card says you're in good standing, you can feel good knowing that the system has recognized your reform.

Personally I think a quarterly review would be more likely to happen. But I love the idea regardless.

Things like this get suggested a lot, but there are some reasons why they aren't implemented:

* Much of the toxicity in League is from people who aren't normally toxic, but are having a bad day. Reporting people is a good thing, but people would feel angry when their reports don't result in punishment as often as they believe they should. This is one of the hardest things for me to remember because I think I feel like most people: I don't report for nothing and I expect a response. It doesn't always work out that way, however.

* When you give people a thermometer for how close they are to punishment, it gives them a way to maximize their toxicity while remaining safe. That's not cool.

* People are already unsurprised by punishments - they receive warnings in advance. That or they're super-toxic and they get what they deserve

* As far as "false reports" tallies go, that's a highly grey area. A low-weight reporter might report you correctly, but not have much affect on your account. Conversely, the checking systems might nullify a report by a high-weight reporter. Both of those are "false", but mean vastly different things. The thing is, unless you're seeing the warning popup, you shouldn't be worried about reports at all.

Your assumption is that players who are negative will get good cards, and players who are positive will get bad cards. I believe in Riot's system, I believe them when they talk about how accurate their system is now. Riot does as well, obviously.

I think the only edge cases would be players who are moderately negative or rarely flame - with these players the reform card part would come into play. That part is Riot telling them "Your attitude is fine most of the time, but the attitudes shown in these 2 games are not accepted by the community, steer away from them." 

That way players who are skirting the edges also have a possibility of improving their attitudes. Also, those who claim "They are just premade kids trolling me" will have a monthly card calling them out on their bullshit. I've often heard players talk about reading what they said in past games and thinking "Did I really say that? Damn. That's not good."

Basically I think the edge case scenario you're describing is so extremely unlikely I highly doubt it's ever going to happen. And I think the benefits and more important the *transparency* is very important.
